bill.title: Elections: qualifications for certain state offices; advanced ballot signature exceptions for certain disabled voters, associated affidavit requirements and perjury liability; audits of election results.
bill.description: Elections: qualifications for certain state offices; advanced ballot signature exceptions for certain disabled voters, associated affidavit requirements and perjury liability; audits of election results.

history.action: House Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Elections
House Hearing: Wednesday, January 31, 2018, 01:30 PM Room 281-N
House Committee Report without recommendation by Committee on Elections
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Carpenter
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Carpenter was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Whitmer
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Whitmer was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Williams
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Williams was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Miller
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Miller was rejected  Yea: 34 Nay: 82
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Lusker
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Lusker was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 94 Nay: 28
House Engrossed on Tuesday, February 20, 2018
Senate Received and Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Ethics, Elections and Local Government
Senate Hearing: Wednesday, March 07, 2018, 09:30 AM Room 142-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Ethics, Elections and Local Government
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Hardy
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Hardy was rejected
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Sykes
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Sykes was rejected  Yea: 19 Nay: 20
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 29 Nay: 9
House Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Representative Esau , Representative Carpenter and Representative Miller as conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Bowers,  Senator Fitzgerald and  Senator Faust-Goudeau appointed as conferees
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator Bowers,  Senator Fitzgerald and  Senator Faust-Goudeau appointed as second conferees
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Esau,  Representative Carpenter and  Representative Miller appointed as second conferees
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 32 Nay: 4
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 70 Nay: 52
House Reengrossed on Wednesday, May 2, 2018
House Enrolled and presented to Governor on Tuesday, May 08, 2018
House Approved by Governor on Friday, May 18, 2018

votes.desc: House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Miller was rejected - Yea: 34 Nay: 82
House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 94 Nay: 28
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Sykes was rejected - Yea: 19 Nay: 20
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 29 Nay: 9
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 32 Nay: 4
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 70 Nay: 52
